message.content:
cs.LG, cs.DS, cs.AI, cs.SI, cs.IT. 

The paper deals with the problem of learning linear separators in the presence of bounded noise, which is a fundamental problem in machine learning and falls under the category of statistical learning theory. Therefore, cs.LG (Machine Learning) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also involves the use of margin-based techniques, which are commonly used in active learning, suggesting that it could also belong to cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.SI (Social and Information Networks). Additionally, the paper involves the study of lower bounds, which is a topic in computational complexity theory, making cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) a likely sub-category. Finally, the paper involves the analysis of the computational efficiency of the algorithm, which could also fall under cs.IT (Information Theory).
